channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole near ramp, 16th February
item.description:
Large pothole and quite deep will cause damage if going over it. Filled with water due to the rain but it is getting bigger everyday. Been like it for some time now
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edington Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence falling down, 16th February
item.description:
I have reported this issue several times and nothing has been done. My fence is breaking due to the amount of rubbish being dumped by the side. I was told it will be dealt with several times still nothing. Please I would like this issue to be resolved soon.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kentlea Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Xxxx enormous pothole xxxx, 16th February
item.description:
50 x 80 x 60 size pothole wrecking cars wheels and suspension!!! I will send you my invoice for the repairs to my nearside whee and suspension just as soon as it’s been repaired!! Disgraceful that the locals have to send multiple reports yet no provisions are made either to protect road users or their cars and potentially endangering lives of other road users.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Avery Hill Road, Avery Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected rubbish attracting wildlife / hazard to domestic animals, 16th February
item.description:
This rubbish has been left for over a week now with the usual bin lorry collections refusing to take it. The rubbish has now been ripped open by wildlife and the contents strewn across the public footpath and it is encouraging foxes, rsts and gulls. There is also a health concern for domestic pets as the discarded food contents is accessible to all. This is a common occurrence at this location and needs to be rectified as soon as possible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tunnel Avenue, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drips and no drainage making pavement slippy, 16th February
item.description:

item.title: Tactile paving broken, 16th February
item.description:
Tactile paving broken on the northern side of the crossing on Felixstowe Road. This has become a prolonged issue as there are numermous vehicles driving in and out of Tilston Bright Square.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tilston Bright Square, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous fly tipping becoming more frequent with no resolution, 16th February
item.description:
Further to ref: 8914360, 8880708, 8849897, 8730739, 8676867, and 8682206, the issue of constant fly tipping, with black rubbish bags and other rubbish being left out in the communal pathway, continues unresolved week after week. This latest instance occurred on the evening of 15 Feb or very early in the morning of 16 Feb. Attention to this matter to stop it from happening continuously, week after week, is urgently needed. In fact the problem has worsened with fly tipping in this area having now occurred 3 times in the last week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deceased animal possible badger, 16th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104, Plaistow Lane, Widmore, Greater London
